rationale: In an era defined by pervasive digital connectivity, Cyber Security stands as a vital shield against the ever-evolving landscape of cyber threats. Mastery of Cyber Security principles and tools transcends specific programming languages yet demands their application for effective defense strategies. This discipline is integral to the education of Information & communication technology, synergizing with other programming courses to foster a holistic understanding of software development. By equipping students with the expertise to identify, mitigate, and combat cyber risks, Cyber Security education cultivates responsible professionals capable of safeguarding critical data and infrastructures in our interconnected world.
competency: Apply diverse Cyber Security frameworks and methodologies for threat detection and mitigation within real-world scenarios.

courseOutcomes.description: Understand the fundamental principles of cybersecurity, apply them to analyze, evaluate, and implement effective security measures in digital environments.
Implement security strategy encompassing authentication, authorization, defense against malicious software.
Secure web communications and applications by applying security protocols, managing ports, and implementing HTTPS, SSH, and VPN technologies.
Conduct ethical hacking and protect systems using Kali Linux tools and vulnerability assessment techniques.
Identify types of cybercrimes, understand their impact, and apply forensic techniques to investigate and prevent cyber-criminal activities.

practicalExercises.description: Implement the following Substitution & Transposition Techniques concepts: a) Caesar Cipher b) Column Transformation
Implement Private key Cryptography algorithm in python.
Implement Message digest 5 and Secure Hash Function using python.
Simulate a brute-force attack to crack passwords of varying strengths (weak, moderate, and strong) and measure the time it takes to crack each password. (Python code or any other tool)
Set up squid proxy and Windows firewall to observe their effectiveness in blocking unauthorized network traffic.
Create a Simple Packet Filter Script using pydivert package in python.
Create malicious script for generating multiple folders using python.
Create malicious script for keylogger using python. (use pynput package)

Use Nmap to scan a network and identify open ports on a web server, then configure a firewall to block all ports except essential ones (e.g., 80 and 443), and use Nmap again to verify the configuration.
a) Installation and configuration of Wireshark. b) Perform Password sniffing using Wireshark. (Analyse GET/POST Request)
a) Installation and configuration of Kali Linux in Virtual box/VMware. b) Perform basic commands in Kali Linux.
Perform Memory forensic using Memoryze tool. (https://fireeye.market/apps/211368)
Perform web Artifact analysis and registry analysis using Autopsy. (https://www.sleuthkit.org/autopsy/)
Create forensic images of entire local hard drives using FTK IMAGER tool. (https://go.exterro.com/l/43312/2023-05-03/fc4b78)

performanceIndicators.indicator: Analyze and identify a suitable approach for the problem-solving
Prepare a report/presentation for given problem/Viva

hardware: Computer system with operating system: Windows 10 or higher Ver., macOS, and Linux, with 4GB or higher RAM

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member
Practice environment friendly methods and processes

unitOutcomes.description: Define cyber security and its importance in protecting digital assets and information.
Explain the CIA triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability) and its significance in designing secure systems.
Define key terms such as adversary, attack, countermeasure, risk, security policy, system resource, threat, and vulnerability in the context of computer security.
Identify common security attacks, mechanisms, and services associated with each layer of the OSI model.
Explain the principles behind asymmetric encryption and how it enhances data security in various scenarios.
Understand how hashing algorithms are used to ensure data integrity and authentication in digital communications and storage systems.

topics.title: Overview of Cyber Security: Definition, importance, and evolution
Basic concept of computer security: CIA triad
The OSI Security Architecture (security attacks, mechanisms, and services)

unitOutcomes.description: Define authentication and its significance in cybersecurity.
Define authorization and its significance in cybersecurity.
Explain different types of malicious software and their effect.
Explain different types of attack on account and data.

topics.title: Authorization definition and methods
subtopics: Firewalls (packet filter, application proxy, personal firewall)

unitOutcomes.description: Explain the impact of web security threats on integrity, confidentiality and authentication.
Explain the importance of network ports and identify key ports such as 80 (HTTP) and 443 (HTTPS) in web security.
Explain SSL and TLS protocols to encrypt data transmissions, ensuring secure communication over networks.
Describe the role of digital signatures and digital certificates.
Explain how VPNs create secure, encrypted connections over public networks to ensure privacy and data protection for remote users.

topics.title: Ports: importance of ports, types, example (443,80 etc)
Secure Socket Layer and Transport Layer Security

unitOutcomes.description: Understand the ethical behavior with unethical behavior.
Understand basic terminology as it relates to the Kali Linux distribution.
To learn about various types of attacks, attackers and security threats and vulnerabilities.
To learn about scanning of systems/applications and System Protection.

topics.title: Concept of Hacking Types of Hackers
Introduction to Kali Linux OS, Configuration of Kali Linux, Basic Commands Kali Linux, Vulnerability Scanning/Vulnerability Based Hacking
What is Sniffing and Mechanism of Sniffing Session Hijacking

unitOutcomes.description: Understand the cybercrimes from the nature of the crime.
Analyze various aspects of Cybercrimes.
Understand the security and privacy methods in development of modern applications and in organizations to protect people and to prevent cybercrimes.
Analyze how particular social engineering attacks are important consideration for cyber security
Describe the basic concepts of Forensic and Branches of Digital Forensic.

topics.title: Introduction to Cyber Crime â€“ Types of Cyber Crime
Classification of Cyber Crimes
subtopics: 5.2.1. Organization: Email Bombing, Salami Attack, Web Jacking, Data diddling, Distributed Denial of Service, Ransomware
5.2.2. Individual: Cyber bullying, Cyber stalking, Cyber defamation, Cyber fraud and Cyber theft, Spyware, Email spoofing, Man in the middle attack
5.2.3. Society: Cyber terrorism, cyber spying, Social Engineering Attack, Online gambling
5.2.4. Property: Credit Card Fraud, Software Piracy, Copyright, infringement, Trademarks violations

topics.title: Overview: Disk Forensics, Network Forensics, Wireless Forensics, Database Forensics, Malware Forensics, Mobile Forensics, Email Forensics

studentActivities: Provide students with real-world case studies of cyber attacks and have them analyze the incidents, identify vulnerabilities exploited, and suggest mitigation strategies
Organize competitions where students can practice ethical hacking skills and solve security challenges
Develop and conduct an awareness campaign on cybersecurity best practices for the campus community, including creating informative posters, videos, and presentations
Students are encouraged to register themselves in various MOOCs such as: Swayam, edX, Coursera, Udemy etc. to further enhance their learning
Undertake micro-projects to develop simple security tools, such as password generators, encryption/decryption programs, or network monitoring tools
Organize guest lectures and workshops with industry professionals to provide insights into the latest trends, challenges, and technologies in cybersecurity
Conduct security audits of the institute's IT infrastructure under supervision, identifying potential vulnerabilities and suggesting improvements
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics
Diagnosing Essential Missed Learning concepts that will help for students
Guide Students to do Personalized learning so that students can understand the course material at his or her pace
Encourage students to do Group learning by sharing so that teaching can easily be enhanced
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities
Guide students on how to address issues on environment and sustainability using the knowledge of this course

microProjects.title: Create a script that configures basic firewall rules using iptables
microProjects.description: Develop firewall configuration script to block or allow specific types of network traffic

microProjects.title: Develop a Python-based web application with multi-factor authentication
microProjects.description: Build web application incorporating password-based authentication and additional factor like OTP or biometric authentication

microProjects.title: Write a Python program using Scapy for network packet analysis
microProjects.description: Create program to capture and analyze network packets for monitoring network traffic

microProjects.title: Develop a DoS attack simulation
microProjects.description: Build simulation demonstrating basic DoS attack on server and implement detection/mitigation measures

microProjects.title: Develop a Python program for system monitoring
microProjects.description: Create program monitoring system logs and network traffic for suspicious activities and generates alerts

microProjects.title: Create a web vulnerability scanner tool
microProjects.description: Build tool scanning web applications for common vulnerabilities such as SQL injection, XSS, and weak authentication

microProjects.title: Implement SSH file transfer program
microProjects.description: Develop Python program using paramiko library to securely transfer files between client and server using SSH protocol

microProjects.title: Write VPN server configuration script
microProjects.description: Create script to set up and configure secure VPN server using OpenVPN, demonstrating secure remote access

microProjects.title: Create digital signature program
microProjects.description: Build Python program generating digital signatures for documents and verifying authenticity using PKI

books.title: Handbook Of Digital Forensics and Investigation
books.author: Eoghan Casey

books.title: Penetration Testing: A hands on introduction to hacking
books.author: Georgia Weidman

programOutcomes.description: Engineering practices for society, sustainability & environment
